name: Limit Work in Progress (WIP)
objective: Prevent multitasking inefficiencies and create a pull system.
description: Setting constraints on how many items can exist in a specific state simultaneously. This prevents context switching, reduces queue sizes, and ensures new work is only started when there is capacity (pull system).

activities.name: Define Limits
activities.description: Set a maximum number of tickets for columns (e.g., 'Testing: Max 2').

activities.name: Stop Starting
activities.description: Do not pull new work if the limit is reached.

activities.name: Start Finishing
activities.description: Swarm to clear blocked items to free up capacity.

work_products.name: WIP Policies
work_products.description: Agreed upon limits displayed on the board.

benefits: Improves quality by reducing context switching.
pitfalls: Setting limits too high (no tension created).

name: Collective Code Ownership
objective: Prevent knowledge silos and bottlenecks by allowing anyone to edit any code.
description: A policy where any developer can change any line of code in the system to add functionality or fix bugs. There are no 'owners' of specific modules. This relies heavily on a safety net of automated tests.

activities.name: Access
activities.description: Ensure all devs have access to all repositories.

activities.name: Modify
activities.description: Developers change whatever is needed to complete their story.

benefits: Eliminates bottlenecks (waiting for 'the guy' who knows the module).
pitfalls: Lack of discipline leading to 'spaghetti code' (mitigated by TDD).
Dilution of responsibility ('someone else will fix it').

name: On-Site Customer
objective: Provide immediate guidance and answer questions to avoid documentation delays.
description: A real customer or empowered proxy sits with the team full-time to answer questions and prioritize work instantly. This replaces written specifications with real-time conversation and decision-making.

activities.name: Collocate
activities.description: Customer sets up workspace with the developers.

activities.name: Clarify
activities.description: Customer answers questions as they arise.

completion_criteria: Customer is accessible for immediate feedback.
benefits: Ensures the product built matches the need.
pitfalls: The Customer becomes a bottleneck if they are the only source of truth.
